text: A Spike protein or peplomer is a glycoprotein spike on the outside layer (or capsid) of a virus. as cited in When a virus attaches to a cell, these peplomers can only attach to certain receptors on the cell. They are very important for choosing which cell it attaches to and how infectious a virus is. ==Related pages== * Viral entry ==References== Category:Viruses
title: Spike protein
